content: long-tail co 80 sts join in the round place a bor marker co 2 sts 1 k 2 slide sts to right side of dpn right needle becomes left needle do not turn f o l d e d e d g e repeat row 1 until i-cord drawstring is 20 50 cm long pull/stretch i-cord every few row 1-5 k to eor 80 6 *yo k2tog k 38 sts repeat from * once to finish i-cord cut yarn and with yarn more needle thread the tail through the 2 sts and 7 k 80 sts to eor pull to tighten with yarn needle weave in the 8 fold cast on edge inward so the knit sts end and cut excess repeat once more to make are facing out pick up first loop from cast a second i-cord on edge and place it on the left needle knit this cast on loop with the st that was feed the i-cord through the folded edge already on the needle as if knitting 2 attach a safety pin to one end of the i-cord together k2tog repeat *pu loop k2tog* to push the safety pin through one of the eor you have now brought the cast on openings in the folded edge then run the edge inward to create a folded and hollow safety pin and i-cord along the entire edge edge for the drawstring i-cord circumference exiting the same place where you entered repeat to the other side of bag with other i-cord b o d y 1 k 80 sts to eor repeat round 1 until work is 11 26 5 cm tall bobble with a new length of yarn and yarn needle sew the cast on edge closed with any seaming method i e mattress stitch whip stitch etc if using the whip stitch turn work inside-out purl side before sewing turn inside-out to if tie a knot on each side of the i-cord not already weave in end and trim excess drawstrings and tighten pull the drawstrings to test opening and closing the bag 3 of 5 dahlia drawstring bags | knitting pattern | © woolbird & joann stores i n s t r u c t i o n s continued e m b r o i d e r y place 3 markers to identify the center of each daisy markers are placed 10 rounds below the folded edge marker 1 center of bag measure width and find center approximately 5 marker 2 6 stitches to the left of marker 1 marker 3 6 stitches to the right of marker 1 embroider 3 lazy daisies along the front using a contrasting color yarn and yarn needle weave in the ends and cut excess it may be helpful to practice a lazy daisy before beginning 4 of 5 dahlia drawstring bags | knitting pattern | © woolbird & joann stores f i n i s h i n g & c a r e use a yarn
